alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:56PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Helena, north central Livingston, East Feliciana, northern Tangipahoa and northwestern Washington Parishes, Walthall, Pike and Amite Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 856 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Darlington, or 9 miles northwest of Greensburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Mccomb, Clinton, Liberty, Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Magnolia, Kentwood, Summit, Independence, Tylertown, Roseland, Wilson, Osyka, Montpelier, Darlington, Mount Herman, Wilmer and Salem. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 36 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Washington
